{{Infobox television | show_name = Philippine Agenda | image = [[image:gma philagenda.jpg|220px]] | caption = | format = [[News]], [[current affairs (news format)|current affairs]] | camera = | picture_format = [[480i]] [[SDTV]] | runtime = 1 hour | creator = [[GMA Network]] | developer = [[GMA News and Public Affairs]] | executive_producer = | starring = [[Jessica Soho]]
[[Mike Enriquez]]
[[Mel Tiangco]]
[[Arnold Clavio]]
[[Vicky Morales]] | narrated = | opentheme = | endtheme = | languages = [[Filipino language|Filipino]] | country = [[Philippines]] | network = [[GMA Network]] | first_aired = 25 March 2007 | last_aired = 13 May 2007 | num_episodes = | website = http://www.gmanews.tv/show/philagenda }} '''Philippine Agenda''' is an eight-part news and public affairs program of the [[GMA Network]] about the [[Philippine general elections, 2007|2007 Philippine elections]] hosted by five journalists of GMA Network : [[Jessica Soho]], [[Mel Tiangco]], [[Vicky Morales]], [[Mike Enriquez]] and [[Arnold Clavio]]. Each episode will tackle issues that the Philippines faces.{{Cite web| url = http://www.gmanews.tv/story/35058/Philippine-Agenda-spotlights-issues-in-May-polls-airs-Sunday | title = 'Philippine Agenda' spotlights issues in May polls, airs Sunday| accessdate = March 24, 2007| author = GMANews.tv| language = [[English language|English]]}} ==Issues== {| class="wikitable" |- bgcolor="#CCCCCC" ! width=120px|Issue !! Original airdate !! Host !! Episode # |- bgcolor="#B0E0E6" | colspan="6" | |- | [[Education]] || March 25, 2007 || [[Jessica Soho]] ||align="center"| 1 |- | colspan="4" | Jessica Soho discusses the deteriorating system of education in the Philippines. |- bgcolor="#B0E0E6" | colspan="5" | |- | [[Healthcare]] || April 1, 2007 || [[Arnold Clavio]] ||align="center"| 2 |- | colspan="4" | Arnold Clavio examines the healthcare system in the country.{{Cite web| url = http://www.gmanews.tv/story/36218/Philippine-Agenda-Health-issues-May-14-bets-must-face | title = Philippine Agenda: Health issues May 14 bets must face | accessdate = March 31, 2007| author = GMANews.tv| language = [[English language|English]]}} |- bgcolor="#B0E0E6" | colspan="5" | |- | [[Political corruption|Corruption]] || April 8, 2007 || [[Mike Enriquez]] ||align="center"| 3 |- | colspan="4" | Mike Enriquez investigates the widespread corruption in the government. Philippine Agenda finds several anomalous projects in different parts of the country.{{Cite web| url = http://www.gmanews.tv/story/36847/Corruption | title = Corruption | accessdate = April 6, 2007| author = GMANews.tv| language = [[English language|English]]}} |- bgcolor="#B0E0E6" | colspan="5" | |- | [[House|Housing]] || April 15, 2007 || [[Mel Tiangco]] ||align="center"| 4 |- | colspan="4" | Mel Tiangco discusses the problems of housing in the Philippines and what are the long term plans of the government that will address this issue.{{Cite web| url = http://www.gmanews.tv/story/37694/Philippine-Agenda-Housing | title = Philippine Agenda: Housing | accessdate = April 10, 2007| author = GMANews.tv| language = [[English language|English]]}} |- bgcolor="#B0E0E6" | colspan="5" | |- | [[Employment|Jobs]] || April 22, 2007 || [[Vicky Morales]] ||align="center"| 5 |- | colspan="4" | Vicky Morales analyzes why most Filipinos prefer to work in other countries than in the Philippines and why do most people are still unemployed.{{Cite web| url = http://www.gmanews.tv/story/38680/Philippine-Agenda-Jobs | title = Philippine Agenda: Jobs | accessdate = April 22, 2007| author = GMANews.tv| language = [[English language|English]]}} |- bgcolor="#B0E0E6" | colspan="5" | |- | [[Malnutrition|Hunger]] || April 29, 2007 || [[Mike Enriquez]] ||align="center"| 6 |- | colspan="4" | Mike Enriquez tackles the effects of undernourishment and the issues surrounding hunger.{{Cite web| url = http://www.gmanews.tv/story/39585/Philippine-Agenda-Hunger | title = Philippine Agenda: Hunger | accessdate = April 26, 2007| author = GMANews.tv| language = [[English language|English]]}} |- bgcolor="#B0E0E6" | colspan="5" | |- | [[Crime]] and [[Justice]] || May 6, 2007 || [[Arnold Clavio]] ||align="center"| 7 |- | colspan="4" | Arnold Clavio investigates how the government handles the situation of criminality and justice in the country and the issues surrounding the judicial system.{{Cite web| url = http://www.gmanews.tv/story/40540/Philippine-Agenda-Crime | title = Philippine Agenda: Crime | accessdate = May 6, 2007| author = GMANews.tv| language = [[English language|English]]}} |- bgcolor="#B0E0E6" | colspan="5" | |- | [[Electoral reform]] || May 13, 2007 || [[Jessica Soho]] ||align="center"| 8 |- | colspan="4" | Jessica Soho examines how the electoral process works in the Philippines.{{Cite web| url = http://www.gmanews.tv/story/41464/Philippine-Agenda-Electoral-Reforms | title = Philippine Agenda: Electoral Reform | accessdate = May 10, 2007| author = GMANews.tv| language = [[English
